column1: Vị Thanh is a provincial city and also the capital city of Hậu Giang Province in Vietnam. Formerly
column2: it was the capital town of Chương-Thiện province in South Vietnam. In 2004
column3: Vị Thanh became the capital of Hậu Giang Province. It has an industrial zone of 880
column4: 000 square metres (217 acres). There are roads
column5: National Highway 61 (which leads to National Road 1A which leads to Cần Thơ Municipality on the Hậu River which leads to Ho Chi Minh City)
column6: and water connections by canal and river to the Hậu River.
